summary: NGS panel testing utilized in only 38% of eligible cases, far below the 65% benchmark. Increasing NGS utilization represents a $245,000 annual opportunity in improved therapy matching.

financial_impact.math: $245,000/year = 27% testing gap (NGS) × 65 patients × $14,000 improved therapy matching

clinical_impact.description: Comprehensive NGS panel testing improves therapy matching and patient outcomes.

metrics.description: Improved therapy matching rate with NGS vs. single-gene testing
Overall survival benefit with NGS-guided therapy selection

peer_comparison.description: Leading oncology practices utilize NGS panel testing in 75% of eligible cases compared to your 38%, resulting in better outcomes.

financial_impact.math: $335,000/year = 37% gap to peer benchmark × 65 patients × $14,000 improved care value

action_steps.text: Develop NGS panel ordering pathway in EMR
Create decision support tool for molecular testing
Implement automatic trigger for NGS at diagnosis for advanced disease
Develop NGS-first protocol for advanced solid tumors
Implement liquid biopsy program for tissue-limited cases
Create provider education program on comprehensive testing
Establish NGS test utilization tracking dashboard

suggestions.text: Evaluate use of rapid RNA-seq for quick therapy matching
Consider in-house NGS capability vs. send-out testing
